extends java.lang.Object

    Connect4TextConsole()

    • grid

      char[][] grid
      This creates the array that we will use for our game board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Connect4TextConsole

      public Connect4TextConsole()
      This constructor creates our initial game board that the program will interact with.

  • Method Details

    • createUI

      public void createUI​(char[][] grid)
      This is used to create a new board. We need this to reflect the changes the players make to the board with each turn.
      Parameters:
      grid - used for the board

    • checkIfValidPlay

      public boolean checkIfValidPlay​(int column)
      This is used to make sure that there is not an element already present when the player is making a choice where to pur their Letter. If the move is invalid it asks the user to put their letter in a column that is not full.
      Parameters:
      column - that the user wants to insert their letter into
      Returns:
      boolean that indicated whether the move is valid

    • insertPiece

      public void insertPiece​(char piece, int column)
      This inserts the letter into the intended column. The series of if statements are used to determine where the letter will land when inserted into the column.
      Parameters:
      piece - the players letter
      column - where the player wants to place thier letter

    • nextTurnO

      public void nextTurnO()
      Simple method to let Player O know it is their turn.

    • nextTurnX

      public void nextTurnX()
      Simple method to let Player X know it is their turn.

    • enterAnotherColumn

      public void enterAnotherColumn()
      Simple method to let the player know that the column they chose is full.

    • verticalCheckWinner

      public boolean verticalCheckWinner​(char playersLetter, int column)
      Determines if the play has connected 4 letter vertically.
      Parameters:
      playersLetter -
      column - on the game board
      Returns:

    • horizontalCheckWinner

      public boolean horizontalCheckWinner​(char playersLetter)
      Determines if the player has connected 4 letter horizontally.
      Parameters:
      playersLetter -
      Returns:
      if the user is a winner or not

    • diagonalChecker

      public boolean diagonalChecker​(char playersLetter)
      Determines if the player has connected 4 letters diagonally.
      Parameters:
      playersLetter -
      Returns:
      if the player is a winner or not

    • oppositeDiagonalChecker

      public boolean oppositeDiagonalChecker​(char playersLetter)
      Determines if the user has connected 4 letter diagonally.
      Parameters:
      playersLetter - this will be either an 'X' or an 'O'
      Returns:
      if the user is a winner or not.
